text: Mae hong son living museum walkabout tour
it's a new morning
had another change plans because

as you can see around haze and smoke is
still quite bad so

its pointless us driving to an area
of scenic beauty

when you wont be able to see the views so we were
going to head to a place called
Pang Oung reservoir which is really really nice its called the switzerland of
North Thailand and you can see why when you go there weve been there before
eden loved running around, we took friends there

and theres black swans a lake and if you go
there early in the morning
you get to see the mist rising from the lake, its a really nice place, pine trees
quite unique looking and also we were going to go to Ban Rak Thai

which is the Chinese village on the
border now we are
decided to do a bit more exploration around town instead
go to one of our favourite coffee shops here,
which is quite modern for mae hong son
lets check it out
this coffee shop is called
Alawaa which is the name of a
famous Tai Yai desert, but they dont sell the desert here
they just named the coffee shop after it
they do sell homemade soaps & soaps made of Placenta, which is quite interesting
not the kind of thing i would have expected to find in mae hong son.
and i like this wall, i like the surface of the wall
weve actually been to mae hong son quite few times
but its only in the last two visits that weve actually walked around town
properly explored
little bits and pieces around town that we always miss out on because we were leaving so soon
so its nice to walk around, take in the streets
and the architecture and temples
sach is not happy with the quality of the coffee though
i havent found a delicious coffee yet
its quite bitter, tastes burnt and bitter
finished our coffees

i think the whole bitter coffee issue is more to do with 
the beans because
pretty much every coffee shop weve been to
so far has had the same kind of taste
im still on the lookout for a lovely coffee

now we're gonna go see the mae hong son
living Museum Center
which is meant to be a motion to

keep mae hong son and its cultures and
traditions
alive, were gonna go check it out
see whats in there, what its like
they have a tribe's museum upstairs
so have to change shoes
so theyve got the different tribes and their
style of clothing up here
shan
that's what mae hong so looked like 50 years ago.... not too different
that was quite interesting basically shows you the history of MAe hong son
theyve got a map that shows you where all the old buildings are

lady in there told us where to find a
alawaa from, that traditional dessert
that that shop was named after so were gonna go see if we can find some
couldnt find the alawaa shop just yet but we are doing a historical tour
apparently this
is an ancient coffee shop in thai yai burmese style
attached to the coffee shop is this burmese style house
you have to contact the shop before you just walk in
my great grandfather
so this man built the house
and this is a rifle stand
129 years old
old pestle and mortor
that was nice that was baan boran coffee shop and house
the lady was showing us around her home
you have to ask permission because she still lives there
thats the reason you have to ask permission, you cant just walk into her home
so when youre walking around mar hong son
look out for these gold signs on the buildings
it means these particular buildings are listed buildings
they have been repaired
and restored
in the traditional mae hong son thai yai or burmese fashion
in fact yesterday, i needed to get a jubilee clip for a part on my car
and i walked into this guys store and i had no idea it was actually a tourist attraction
full of parts
according to the map
this building here was mae hong sons very first hotel
its not now, but it was
there are tons of pigeons over there
another one of the burmese style temples
i dont know what this dangerous metal contraption flapping about in the wind is
but its at head level, so im gonna stay clear
incase i get a spanking
so that seems to be it for the historical tour
it was good to have that map
should pick one up form the living centre
because it just adds a layer of depth
we pass by these buildings countless times and didnt have a clue what they were
and now it gives them some meaning
we are on our way to the handicraft centre
which isnt too far from our hotel
but its very hot
its 35 degrees today
so we made it to the handicraft centre
although it looks like they are about to close
quick look around before they shut
they are also playing some trance music outside
looks like they are trying to set up for osme kind of event
dont have a clue what the music is all about
looks like its gonna be a loud one tonight
what does it say
it says that the 2nd floor should have been a exibition
butt here was nothing on
and the other floor should have had the craftsman actually doing their work
and there was noone in there
all the lights were off
nevermind
so the mae hong son handicraft centre wasnt quite what we were expecting
theyve got something like this in chiang mai
theres actually people in there weaving things and carving things
while you walk around
it does shut in like half an hour and it is like 35 degrees
they probably thought ahhh noones going to come
lets go home
another cute little cafe discovery
saifon
we were just saying, with a name like saifon either they serve syphon coffee
or its gonna be like a very thai style cafe
chintzy pretty mixture of chic flowery goodness
and cakes
i dont think they do syphon coffee though
off we go again
all ready for another journey eden
im always ready for a car journey
youre blending in to the seat
blend
one of the disadvantages of coming up to mae hong son
is there is no lpg stations anywhere
so if your fuel pump doesnt work on your car and you can only run on lpg
dont come to mae hong son
coz you aint getting home boy
no lpg in mae hong son. remember.
so we just had to fill up with normal fuel
and it hurt
it hurt spending all that money on petrol
got to get home somehow
i enjoyed our little trip in mae hong son
always find everytime we go there i like it a little bit more
its our 7th time there now
each time we always find something that makes it a little bit nicer
contrast to pai, if you are going to go to mae hong son
its a better idea to go in the high season
between november and december
because thats when the bua tong sunflowers are blooming
adn that is quite beautifulthing to see
there not there for long though
only about 2-3weeks at that time of year
we got over 300km to cover today
were now going to chiang mai
so we have got quite a while to go until we get there
our day will be full up with driving
so that concludes our trip through mae hong son
we didnt find the alawaa in the end
so it will give us something to try out and something to look forward to next time we are in the area
our next few videos will be from chiang mai
were actualyl really excited to be back here
its where we used to live for 2 years so it will be very exciting to see what new things have changed since we have been away
i have a question for you viewers
i would like to know what the very first video of ours you saw
we are always curious to know how people find our videos so that we can keep doing things that you like
keep watching if you like what we do
give us a thumbs up and like and comment
and we will see you next time
bye
